meanings.sent1: The tree looked limby with its many branches.
meanings.sent2: The monkey's limby arms helped it swing from tree to tree.
meanings.sent3: The limby plant seemed to wave hello in the breeze.
meanings.sent4: Her limby fingers reached out to grab the falling leaf.
meanings.sent5: The limby silhouette of the tree against the sunset was breathtaking.

meanings.definition: Having an abundance of limbs or branches.
meanings.sent1: The limby oak tree provided ample shade in the park.
meanings.sent2: The limby shrub in the garden needed pruning to maintain its shape.
meanings.sent3: The limby tree looked like it was doing a dance in the wind.
meanings.sent4: The limby bush in the backyard was a favorite hiding spot for the cat.
meanings.sent5: The limby branches of the willow tree swayed gracefully in the breeze.

meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of limbs or branches.
meanings.sent1: The limby shadows of the streetlights stretched across the sidewalk.
meanings.sent2: The limby pattern of veins on the leaf was intricate and beautiful.
meanings.sent3: The limby design of the fence made it look like a mini forest.
meanings.sent4: Her hair cascaded down her back in a limby waterfall.
meanings.sent5: The limby patterns of frost on the window created a delicate artwork.
